HDG.IM.content: spiritual fate of the West (lose strength to observe decline) [aside on technological stupidity]: when time is nothing but speed, when a boxer counts as the great man of a people [Heidegger’s racism?]

motif.name: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

HDG.IM.linkedContent: spiritual fate of the West (lose strength to observe decline) [aside on technological stupidity]: when time is nothing but speed, when a boxer counts as the great man of a people [Heidegger’s racism?]

HDG.IM.content: is Being a mere word or does it hold spiritual fate of the West? > this question may sound forced [method: demonstrate by way of assertion] [but the bell tolls, and we count wrong—even our experience of the question]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: is Being a mere word or does it hold spiritual fate of the West? > this question may sound forced [method: demonstrate by way of assertion] [but the bell tolls, and we count wrong—even our experience of the question]

HDG.IM.content: [Heidegger on Marx] spirit as intelligence becomes powerless superstructure to something else, counts as authentic because spirit-less > Marxism in its most extreme form understands spirit as intelligence [?]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: [Heidegger on Marx] spirit as intelligence becomes powerless superstructure to something else, counts as authentic because spirit-less > Marxism in its most extreme form understands spirit as intelligence [?]

HDG.IM.content: “Being” now just counts as sound of a word (Wortlaut) for us, a used-up term (vernutzter Titel): we must grasp all we have left (verbliebt), this last remnant (letzten Rest) of a possession (Besitz) [trace] > how does it stand w/ the word Being?
HDG.IM.linkedContent: “Being” now just counts as sound of a word (Wortlaut) for us, a used-up term (vernutzter Titel): we must grasp all we have left (verbliebt), this last remnant (letzten Rest) of a possession (Besitz) [trace] > how does it stand w/ the word Being?

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger on physics, orients toward calculability of object [not giving descriptions of nature] [announcement vs. appearance of nature?] > Heisenberg’s universal world formula only analogy: “what one must take into account so that, in any event, one can count on something”
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger on physics, orients toward calculability of object [not giving descriptions of nature] [announcement vs. appearance of nature?] > Heisenberg’s universal world formula only analogy: “what one must take into account so that, in any event, one can count on something”

HDG.MA.content: calculative thinking (never stops, never collects itself): computing, when we plan, research, organize, we reckon w/ given conditions, calculated intention of conditions serving specific purposes, count on definite results > meditative thinking: contemplates meaning that reigns in everything that is
HDG.MA.linkedContent: calculative thinking (never stops, never collects itself): computing, when we plan, research, organize, we reckon w/ given conditions, calculated intention of conditions serving specific purposes, count on definite results > meditative thinking: contemplates meaning that reigns in everything that is

HDG.WL.content: diversity of elements in language, an original count (Zählen) not yet enumerable, a belonging together shows itself (ergab sich) > the count is a recounting that anticipates (auf vorblickt) the Einigende im Zusammengëhoren, but can’t make it appear > long history of inability to experience unifying unity of Sprachwesens, thus it remains w/out a name
